result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:49 AM Defendant Joshua L. Otto in court.  Attorney Travis A. Crowell in court for Joshua L. Otto.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF143.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Crowell heard - has reviewed with Deft.

9:50 off record.
9:51 back on record.
Court also calls 22cf213.
Atty Crowell heard - has not been appointed to the 22CF213 case.
Court speaks to deft regarding 213.
Deft heard - does not qualify for Public Defender.
Must file the dean paperwork within 24 hours to be appointed a dean atty on the 22CF213 case.
Court schedules with parties on the 22CF213 case.
Atty Crowell heard on 22cf143 and questions if one atty should be appointed for both cases as he believe he has a conflict with the 213 case.
Court speaks to all parties.
All parties agree.
Deft waives time limits on the 143 case.
Atty Heineck enters the courtroom.
Believes the 2 cases are connected and Atty Crowell should be withdrawn.
Court speaks.
Court schedules with parties.

1:05 PM Defendant Joshua L. Otto appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Robert Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Schraven is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court inquires on Atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Schraven heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2500 signature bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today w/o a valid Rx, may not go to Michigan for any reason.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
1:10 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
